content:
(Prelude: I asked this in the #rust-dev-tools IRC some hours ago, but didn't get an answer. Are we migrating from IRC to Zulip, or is Zulip for different purposes?)

Does anyone know why the rust-lldb script uses --source-before-file specifically? Do the commands need to be sourced before loading the debugging executable?
I am looking for guidance regarding this issue: https://github.com/idanarye/vim-vebugger/issues/64

...more generally, does anyone know of any existing Vim8 or NeoVim debuggers that work with Rust?
(There is currently no mention of a Vim debugger on areweideyet.com)
Or, rather, lldb.nvim is mentioned, but it's unmaintained with no plans to resume maintenance due to upstream LLVM issues, apparently
Can't speak to the debugging issue, but most people are split between Discord, here (only really the NLL working group) and IRC.
